trans-unit.source: A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> objects.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection> contains the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> objects in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
You can retrieve an instance of this class through the control <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Rows%2A> property.
The collection maintains a reference to the control through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.DataGridView%2A> property.
To improve performance, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection> includes shared and unshared rows.
Shared rows share memory to reduce the cost of a large record set.
If your record set is very large, you should be careful to keep the rows shared as much as possible.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that owns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
Adds a new row to the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.Add> overload adds rows that are based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowTemplate%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.
The new row is shared, if possible.
Be sure that the row specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowTemplate%2A> property can be shared for best scalability.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.
The index of the new row.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new rows from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataSource"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> is not `null`.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> has no columns.
-or-
This operation would add a frozen row after unfrozen rows.
The row returned by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowTemplate"></xref> property has more cells than there are columns in the control.
Adds the specified number of new rows to the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.Add%28System.Int32%29> method adds shared rows to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection>.
The new rows are based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowTemplate%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.
Be sure that the row specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowTemplate%2A> property can be shared for best scalability.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.
The number of rows to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
The index of the last row that was added.
count is less than 1.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new rows from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataSource"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> is not `null`.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> has no columns.
-or-
The row returned by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowTemplate"></xref> property has more cells than there are columns in the control.
-or-
This operation would add frozen rows after unfrozen rows.
Adds a new row to the collection, and populates the cells with the specified objects.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.Add%28System.Object%5B%5D%29> method adds an unshared row to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection>.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.
A variable number of objects that populate the cells of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref>.
The index of the new row.
values is `null`.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new rows from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.VirtualMode"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> is set to `true`.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataSource"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> is not `null`.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> has no columns.
-or-
The row returned by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowTemplate"></xref> property has more cells than there are columns in the control.
-or-
This operation would add a frozen row after unfrozen rows.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> to the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.Add%28System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow%29> method adds a shared row to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection>, if possible.
Otherwise, the new row is unshared.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
The index of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref>.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new rows from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataSource"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> is not `null`.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> has no columns.
-or-
The property of the dataGridViewRow is not `null`.
-or-
dataGridViewRow has a property value of `true`.
-or-
This operation would add a frozen row after unfrozen rows.
dataGridViewRow is `null`.
dataGridViewRow has more cells than there are columns in the control.
Adds the specified number of rows to the collection based on the row at the specified index.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.InheritedStyle%2A> property of the new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> has the same values as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.InheritedStyle%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> positioned at `indexSource`.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.AddCopies%2A> method adds shared rows to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection>, if possible.
Otherwise, the new rows are unshared.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.
The index of the row on which to base the new rows.
The number of rows to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
The index of the last row that was added.
indexSource is less than zero or greater than or equal to the number of rows in the control.
-or-
count is less than zero.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new rows from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataSource"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> is not `null`.
-or-
This operation would add a frozen row after unfrozen rows.
Adds a new row based on the row at the specified index.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.InheritedStyle%2A> property of the new row has the same values as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.InheritedStyle%2A> of the row positioned at `indexSource`.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.AddCopy%2A> method adds a shared row to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection>, if possible.
Otherwise, the new row is unshared.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.
The index of the row on which to base the new row.
The index of the new row.
indexSource is less than zero or greater than or equal to the number of rows in the collection.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new rows from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataSource"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> is not `null`.
-or-
This operation would add a frozen row after unfrozen rows.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> objects to the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.AddRange%2A> method adds shared rows to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection>, if possible.
Otherwise, the new rows are unshared.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.

Due to a bug, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.AddRange%2A> method will make your application stop responding if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.AllowUserToAddRows%2A> property is `true` and the row for new records is selected.
To work around this bug, you must cancel the selection of the row before calling this method, and then reselect the row.
For more information, see the code example in this topic.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> objects to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
dataGridViewRows is `null`.
dataGridViewRows contains only one row, and the row it contains has more cells than there are columns in the control.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new rows from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataSource"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> is not `null`.
-or-
At least one entry in the dataGridViewRows array is `null`.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> has no columns.
-or-
At least one row in the dataGridViewRows array has a property value that is not `null`.
-or-
At least one row in the dataGridViewRows array has a property value of `true`.
-or-
Two or more rows in the dataGridViewRows array are identical.
-or-
At least one row in the dataGridViewRows array contains one or more cells of a type that is incompatible with the type of the corresponding column in the control.
-or-
At least one row in the dataGridViewRows array contains more cells than there are columns in the control.
-or-
This operation would add frozen rows after unfrozen rows.
Clears the collection.
The collection is data bound and the underlying data source does not support clearing the row data.
-or-
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents the row collection from being modified:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
Occurs when the contents of the collection change.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> is in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> is in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the items from the collection into the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> array, starting at the specified index.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> array that is the destination of the items copied from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.
Gets the number of rows in the collection.
The number of rows in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that owns the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that owns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
Returns the index of the first <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> that meets the specified criteria.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
The index of the first that has the attributes specified by includeFilter; -1 if no row is found.
includeFilter is not a valid bitwise combination of values.
Returns the index of the first <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> that meets the specified inclusion and exclusion criteria.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
The index of the first that has the attributes specified by includeFilter, and does not have the attributes specified by excludeFilter; -1 if no row is found.
One or both of the specified filter values is not a valid bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
Returns the index of the last <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> that meets the specified criteria.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
The index of the last that has the attributes specified by includeFilter; -1 if no row is found.
includeFilter is not a valid bitwise combination of values.
Returns the index of the next <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> that meets the specified criteria.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.GetNextRow%28System.Int32%2CSystem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates%29> method begins looking for the row that matches the criteria starting with the row positioned after `indexStart`.
The index of the row where the method should begin to look for the next <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref>.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
The index of the first after indexStart that has the attributes specified by includeFilter, or -1 if no row is found.
indexStart is less than -1.
includeFilter is not a valid bitwise combination of values.
Returns the index of the next <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> that meets the specified inclusion and exclusion criteria.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.GetNextRow%28System.Int32%2CSystem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates%2CSystem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates%29> method begins looking for the row that matches the criteria starting with the row positioned after `indexStart`.
The index of the row where the method should begin to look for the next <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref>.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
The index of the next that has the attributes specified by includeFilter, and does not have the attributes specified by excludeFilter; -1 if no row is found.
indexStart is less than -1.
One or both of the specified filter values is not a valid bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
Returns the index of the previous <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> that meets the specified criteria.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.GetPreviousRow%28System.Int32%2CSystem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates%29> method begins looking for the row that matches the criteria starting with the row positioned before `indexStart`.
The index of the row where the method should begin to look for the previous <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref>.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
The index of the previous that has the attributes specified by includeFilter; -1 if no row is found.
indexStart is greater than the number of rows in the collection.
includeFilter is not a valid bitwise combination of values.
Returns the index of the previous <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> that meets the specified inclusion and exclusion criteria.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.GetPreviousRow%28System.Int32%2CSystem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates%2CSystem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates%29> method begins looking for the row that matches the criteria starting with the row positioned before `indexStart`.
The index of the row where the method should begin to look for the previous <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref>.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
The index of the previous that has the attributes specified by includeFilter, and does not have the attributes specified by excludeFilter; -1 if no row is found.
indexStart is greater than the number of rows in the collection.
One or both of the specified filter values is not a valid bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
Returns the number of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> objects in the collection that meet the specified criteria.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
The number of objects in the that have the attributes specified by includeFilter.
includeFilter is not a valid bitwise combination of values.
Returns the cumulative height of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> objects that meet the specified criteria.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values.
The cumulative height of objects in the that have the attributes specified by includeFilter.
includeFilter is not a valid bitwise combination of values.
Gets the state of the row with the specified index.
The index of the row.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values indicating the state of the specified row.
rowIndex is less than zero and greater than the number of rows in the collection minus one.
Returns the index of a specified item in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
The index of value if it is a found in the ; otherwise, -1.
Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> into the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.Insert%28System.Int32%2CSystem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow%29> method adds a shared row to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection>, if possible.
Otherwise, the new row is unshared.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.
The position at which to insert the row.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
rowIndex is less than zero or greater than the number of rows in the collection.
dataGridViewRow is `null`.
The associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control is performing one of the following actions that temporarily prevents new rows from being added:
Selecting all cells in the control.
Clearing the selection.
-or-
This method is being called from a handler for one of the following <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> events:
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataSource"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> is not `null`.
-or-
rowIndex is equal to the number of rows in the collection and the property of the is set to `true`.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> has no columns.
-or-
The property of dataGridViewRow is not `null`.
-or-
dataGridViewRow has a property value of `true`.
-or-
This operation would insert a frozen row after unfrozen rows or an unfrozen row before frozen rows.
dataGridViewRow has more cells than there are columns in the control.
Inserts the specified number of rows into the collection at the specified location.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.Insert%28System.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> method adds rows that are based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowTemplate%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.
The new row is shared, if possible.
Be sure that the row specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowTemplate%2A> property can be shared for best scalability.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.

Inserts a row into the collection at the specified position, and populates the cells with the specified objects.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.Insert%28System.Int32%2CSystem.Object%5B%5D%29> method adds an unshared row to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection>.
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.InheritedStyle%2A> property of the new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> objects has the same values as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.InheritedStyle%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> positioned at `indexSource`.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.InsertCopies%2A> method adds shared rows to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection>, if possible.
Otherwise, the new rows are unshared.
For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.InsertRange%2A> method adds shared rows to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection>, if possible.
Otherwise, the new rows are unshared.

Rows in the control are not automatically sorted when new rows are added.

To sort new rows into their correct position, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowsAdded?displayProperty=fullName> event handler.

You might also want to call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellValueChanged> event handler to sort the rows when the user modifies a cell.

Due to a bug, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.InsertRange%2A> method will make your application stop responding if any rows with an index greater than `rowIndex` are selected.
To work around this bug, you must cancel the selection of these rows before calling this method, and reselect the rows afterward.
For more information, see the code example in this topic.

Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.CollectionChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowCollection.OnCollectionChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
